fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let s\in S, and let X_s=f^{-1}(s). If S is smooth, and if \overline {X} is a smooth compactification of X, then, by , the subspace (\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q})_s^0 of (\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q})_s is the image of \operatorname {H}^n(\overline {X},\mathbb {Q}). Since the restriction map \operatorname {H}^n(\overline {X},\mathbb {Q}) \to \operatorname {H}^n(X_s,\mathbb {Q}) is a morphism of Hodge structures, its image is a Hodge sub-structure, and the induced Hodge structure on \operatorname {H}^0(S,\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q}), given by the quotient of that on \operatorname {H}^n(\overline {X},\mathbb {Q}), is independent of s.

Let f\colon X\to S be a proper smooth morphism, with S reduced, connected, and separated. Let (\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q})^0 be the largest constant local system on \mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q}, with fibre \operatorname {H}^0(S,\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q}). Then, for each s\in S, (\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q})_s^0 is a Hodge sub-structure of (\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q})\simeq \operatorname {H}^n(X_s,\mathbb {Q}), and the induced Hodge structure on \operatorname {H}^0(S,\mathrm {R}^n f_*\mathbb {Q}) is independent of s.
